result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Neal Kohlscheen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 94 days 
granted if revoked.
Court orders 2 years revocation (will be total of 4 years administratively)
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation. If fine is not paid in full during probation, agent to impose 23 days Huber, consecutive for non-payment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Muskego Police Department, to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.  May not use more than one pharmacy for prescriptions.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Sign medical Release Agent.
Defendant to Attend the Victim Impact Panel Meeting.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with work, work search, any court appearances, and treatment to commence FORTHWITH.
